required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Follow Up to Evaluate DTX301 in Adults With Late-Onset OTC Deficiency
clinical_study.official_title: A Long-Term Follow-up Study to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of Adeno-Associated Virus (AAV) Serotype 8 (AAV8)-Mediated Gene Transfer of Human Ornithine Transcarbamylase (OTC) in Adults With Late-Onset OTC Deficiency

brief_summary.textblock: Determine the long-term safety of DTX301 following a single intravenous (IV) dose in adults with late-onset ornithine transcarbamylase (OTC) deficiency.

detailed_description.textblock: Study 301OTC02 is a long-term follow-up study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of adeno-associated virus (AAV) serotype 8 (AAV8)-mediated gene transfer of human OTC in adults with late-onset OTC deficiency. Only subjects who complete Study 301OTC01 (NCT02991144) are eligible to participate in Study 301OTC02.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 260 weeks following DTX301 administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Over Time in the Ureagenesis Rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (average of Screening and Day 1) up to 260 weeks following DTX301 administration
secondary_outcome.description: Sodium acetate is used as a tracer to measure the rate of ureagenesis

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Over Time in 24-Hour Area Under the Curve for Plasma Ammonia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 0 of Study 301OTC01) up to 260 weeks following DTX301 administration

study_pop.textblock: Subjects 18 years of age or older with OTC previously enrolled in Study 301OTC01

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Completed the Week 52 visit in Study 301OTC01.
2. Willing and able to provide written informed consent.
3. Willing, able, and committed to comply with scheduled study site visits, study procedures, and requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Planned or current participation in another interventional clinical study that may confound the efficacy or safety evaluation of DTX301 during the duration of this study.
2. Any clinically significant medical condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, would pose a risk to subject safety or would impede the study.

facility.name: Hospital Universitario de Cruces. Servicio de Pediatria
Queen Elizabeth Hospital, Department of Endocrinology
